params.notEnoughChars: You must enter at least @chars characters!
params.ariaNavigatedToSolution: Navigated to newly included sample solution after textarea.
params.ariaShowSolution: Show the solution. You will be provided with a sample solution.
params.ariaRetry: Retry the task. You can improve your previous answer if the author allowed that.
params.taskDescription:
If set <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>A</mi>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mo fence="false" stretchy="false">{</mo>
  <mtext>red, white, blue</mtext>
  <mo fence="false" stretchy="false">}</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">A = \{\text{red, white, blue}\}</annotation></semantics></math> and set <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>B</mi>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mo fence="false" stretchy="false">{</mo>
  <mtext>green, white, red</mtext>
  <mo fence="false" stretchy="false">}</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">B = \{\text{green, white, red}\}</annotation></semantics></math>, find <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>n</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mi>A</mi>
  <mo>∪<!-- ∪ --></mo>
  <mi>B</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">n(A \cup B)</annotation></semantics></math>.

params.taskDescription:
If set <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>A</mi>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mo fence="false" stretchy="false">{</mo>
  <mtext>silver, gold, bronze</mtext>
  <mo fence="false" stretchy="false">}</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">A = \{\text{silver, gold, bronze}\}</annotation></semantics></math> and set <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>B</mi>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mo fence="false" stretchy="false">{</mo>
  <mtext>silver, gold</mtext>
  <mo fence="false" stretchy="false">}</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">B = \{\text{silver, gold}\}</annotation></semantics></math>, find the number of elements in <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>A</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">A</annotation></semantics></math> or <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>B</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">B</annotation></semantics></math>.

params.taskDescription:
If set <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>A</mi>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mo fence="false" stretchy="false">{</mo>
  <mtext>Algebra, Geometry, Biology, Physics, Chemistry, English</mtext>
  <mo fence="false" stretchy="false">}</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">A = \{\text{Algebra, Geometry, Biology, Physics, Chemistry, English}\}</annotation></semantics></math> and Set <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>B</mi>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mo fence="false" stretchy="false">{</mo>
  <mtext>Algebra, English, History, Spanish, French, Music</mtext>
  <mo fence="false" stretchy="false">}</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">B = \{\text{Algebra, English, History, Spanish, French, Music}\}</annotation></semantics></math>, find <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>n</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mi>A</mi>
  <mo>∪<!-- ∪ --></mo>
  <mi>B</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">n(A \cup B)</annotation></semantics></math>.

questionSetStimulus:
For the following exercises, determine the cardinality of the union of set <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>A</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">A</annotation></semantics></math> and set <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>B</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">B</annotation></semantics></math>.
